TopicTitle: Real fuels not working with tweakscale

Articles.Content:
Real fuels is not working properly with tweakscale

The slider does not show for engines and RCS thrusters and when you rescale a fuel tank only the size changes not the weight or the volume.

I have the new real fuel installed and the latest tweakscale.

Another problem is that if you rescale a root part then go back to the space centre or something else in orbit then when you go back to the object the root part has been scaled down to its original size.

KSP: 0.90 Windows 64bit (ksp runs 32bit)

1. RF disables tweakscale on engines and RCS. Intended.

2. If the size but not volume of tanks are changing, that's a bug and I'll try to fix it for the next RF. Maybe Tweakscale changed how it did something? Did you install RF *after* Tweakscale, so there's a tweakscale_integration folder in your Tweakscale folder?

3. That sounds like a tweakscale bug, you might want to mention it on that mod's thread.

thanks for the quick reply but I solved that issue and replaced it with another. I had not installed the new RF properly and reinstalled and now tweakscale is working fine. However there are no REAL fuels available all the engines consume the standard liquid fuel and oxidiser and nether the tanks or the engines have a GUI to change that.

You're welcome!

As the Real Fuels OP states, you need an Engine Config Pack to actually have engine configs. Your options right now are Realism Overhaul (for 100% real engines) or the Stockalike RF Configs pack if you want engines that keep their roles and names.

Thanks again If I use the Stockalike RF Configs pack should I have modular fuel tanks in the gamedata folder?

god its so confusing what to if I want real fuels, I don't know what mods I do and don't need if I need an engine pack or not. Its really not clear on your page (no disrespect) it would be really helpful if you could just do a straight forward bullet points on -If you want this, do X Y Z If you want this, do A B C

Something like that would make it allot clearer
